snippet: Consumers seem to be willing to give up some choice in favor of lower prices, but critics, including opponents of the new health care law, are wary about narrowing networks.
abstract: Consumers seem to be willing to sacrifice some health care choices in favor of lower prices, but critics, including opponents of new health care law, are wary about narrowing networks, which feature limited groups of providers; insurers say narrower networks are essential to controlling costs and managing care.
lead_paragraph: Consumers seem to be willing to give up some choice in favor of lower prices, but critics, including opponents of the new health care law, are wary about narrowing networks.

headline.main: More Insured, but the Choices Are Narrowing
headline.print_headline: More Insured, but the Choices Are Narrowing

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
